title: 'The love letter to my neighbourhood that helped me flee my country'
description: José Gregorio Márquez was ashamed of the place he grew up, but he came to love it before leaving it forever.

title: Micheál Martin made taoiseach after parties back deal
description: Fianna Fáil, Fine Gael and Green Party members voted to go into government together on Friday.

title: Noah Donohoe: Body found in search for missing teenager
description: A body was recovered in the north Belfast area on Saturday morning, police say.

title: Glasgow hotel stabbings PC David Whyte 'stable'
description: PC David Whyte is among six people injured in a mass stabbing in Glasgow on Friday.

title: Coca-Cola suspends social media advertising despite Facebook changes
description: The company condemns racism and seeks more accountability from Facebook and other platforms.

title: Fans' behaviour 'unacceptable' says Liverpool FC
description: Flares were lit as thousands turned up at the city's waterfront, despite restrictions on gatherings.

title: Coronavirus: UK to open up European holidays from 6 July
description: Customers should be encouraged to book when the list of countries is confirmed, travel sector says.

title: Met Police 'building relationships' over illegal street parties
description: It comes as police officers broke up another illegal street party held in London.

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown flypast marks Armed Forces Day
description: The Red Arrows leave a smoke trail of red, white and blue over North Yorkshire.

title: Ecclestone comments on race ignorant and uneducated - Hamilton
description: Lewis Hamilton says Bernie Ecclestone is "ignorant and uneducated" after the ex-Formula 1 boss made comments about racism.

title: Milton Glaser: Graphic designer behind 'I ♥ NY' logo dies aged 91
description: Milton Glaser also created a famous poster of Bob Dylan and co-founded New York magazine.

title: 'Change is coming' - Black Power salute athlete Smith backs stars taking knee
description: Olympian Tommie Smith, who gave the Black Power salute at the 1968 Games, backs current sports stars taking an anti-racism stand.

title: The campaign to put more pounds into black-owned businesses
description: The wake of the Black Lives Matter protests across the world has left many people thinking of new ways to try to deal with racism and inequalities, including financially.

title: FA Cup: Everything you need to know before the quarter-finals
description: Who is left and what are the big questions as the FA Cup resumes this weekend.

title: Simpsons ends use of white actors to voice people of colour
description: The decision by the US comedy show follows years of criticism over a white actor playing an Indian.

title: Coronavirus lockdown: Why can't some businesses reopen in England yet?
description: Changes to England's lockdown have sparked questions over what opens and what must stay shut.

title: We had a lockdown choice - care for Amy or never see her
description: Parents describe the exhaustion of caring for an adult daughter with learning disabilities in the lockdown.
